name: Vegan German Chocolate Cookies
description: These Vegan German Chocolate Cookies are like small individual German Chocolate Cakes! A soft, chewy chocolate oatmeal cookie with a rich caramel coconut pecan filling in the middle! Trust me, these won’t last long on the cookie plate. No added Oil!
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup almond butter (use natural smooth drippy almond butter)

recipeInstructions.text: Mix all wet ingredients for the cookie (maple syrup through non dairy milk) in a bowl, and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix all wet ingredients for the cookie (maple syrup through non dairy milk) in a bowl, and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Add all dry ingredients, and mix well, set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Add all dry ingredients, and mix well, set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine wet ingredients into the dry. If you want a sweeter cookie, add a tbsp of sugar or maple. Mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine wet ingredients into the dry. If you want a sweeter cookie, add a tbsp of sugar or maple. Mix well.

itemListElement.text: Press and mix so that the mixture is homogenous, and you get a dough. Chill the dough for 15 minutes, meanwhile make the filling
itemListElement.name: Press and mix so that the mixture is homogenous, and you get a dough. Chill the dough for 15 minutes, meanwhile make the filling

itemListElement.text: Add the pecans to a skillet and toast for 2 minutes, then add the coconut and continue to toast until the coconut is golden.
itemListElement.name: Add the pecans to a skillet and toast for 2 minutes, then add the coconut and continue to toast until the coconut is golden.

itemListElement.text: Add in the maple syrup, mix the cornstarch and the milk really well, add it to the pan, then continue to cook the mixture until it thickens a bit.
itemListElement.name: Add in the maple syrup, mix the cornstarch and the milk really well, add it to the pan, then continue to cook the mixture until it thickens a bit.

itemListElement.text: Scoop out 2 tbsp or more of the cookie dough mixture, and roll it out into balls. Press the balls to flatten a bit on a parchment lined baking sheet. Use a deep 1 tsp measure to make dips in the cookie dough.
itemListElement.name: Scoop out 2 tbsp or more of the cookie dough mixture, and roll it out into balls. Press the balls to flatten a bit on a parchment lined baking sheet. Use a deep 1 tsp measure to make dips in the cookie dough.

itemListElement.text: Add the filling to the dips. You want to add enough filling and pile it on because the filling tastes really good, and make the cookie moist.
itemListElement.name: Add the filling to the dips. You want to add enough filling and pile it on because the filling tastes really good, and make the cookie moist.

itemListElement.text: Repeat for all the dough, you can probably get 11-12 cookies total.
itemListElement.name: Repeat for all the dough, you can probably get 11-12 cookies total.

itemListElement.text: Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees F, for 13-15 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees F, for 13-15 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Take the sheet out of the oven, let it sit for a few minutes, then transfer the cookies to a cooling rack.
itemListElement.name: Take the sheet out of the oven, let it sit for a few minutes, then transfer the cookies to a cooling rack.

keywords: German Chocolate Cake cookies, German chocolate cookies, vegan german chocolate cake
